subject: fraudulent id/identity theft
body: Randolph Police   Detective Marc Abramson   Good Afternoon, I am investigating an Identity theft/Fraudulent Credit Card activity where the suspect attempted to open credit cards and other lines of credit. The image is of a fraudulent  drivers license, social security number used not an S#, the personal information is for the victim but the picture is of someone else. The victim was notified by   credit card that an account was being opened in her name and the victim's business information was compromised as well. The suspect had all the personal data on the victim and also business information including Tax ID. I am trying to identify the person in the photo for follow up on knowledge of this activity. Any help is greatly appreciated. Thank you

subject: Re:  Identity fraud cases: PR license informat ion
body: Boyle, Christopher (DOT)  [mailto:Christopher.P.Boyle@dot.state.ma.us]  Thursday,  August 01, 2019 7:50 PM  Reisman,  Haleigh (EAS)  Haleigh,  I w ill do my best. I'm not exactly sure that the PR "certifies"  anything  from t he RMV. We submit all of our requests through t he PR  Fusion  Center and they come back on t heir lett erhead. At a minimum, we can  give t hat a try.  I w ill call PR t omorrow and see if they can do any better t han t hat.  Did your subject have a MA license?  We can get you all of the MA  records certified . Even if was j ust a MAID.  Could you also give me your subjects info please?   Thanks,   Chris Lieutenant Christopher Boyle #2710 Massachusetts State Police Division of Homeland Security and Preparedness Fraud Identification Unit nd 10 Park Plaza, 2  Floor Boston, MA  02116 christopher.p.boyle@dot.state.ma.us cell: 781-738-7286 badge On Aug 1, 2019, at 3:52 PM, Reisman, Haleigh (EAS) <Haleigh.Reisman@massmail.state.ma.us> wrote: Good afternoon Lieutenant Boyle,   One of my colleagues, Kelly Waldo, indicated that you might be my saving grace for a trial I have coming up next week.  I’ve been trying to figure out how to prove my case —it was an investigation after a random query on a license plate when an officer got a double hit on an FBI number.  A few months later, a motor vehicle stop was conducted and my defendant (who claimed to be one “ ” from PR) was arrested for identity fraud.  It took a couple of days, but they were able to obtain his identity based on a hit on facial recognition on a Dominican passport.  I’m on a much tighter timeline than Kelly is—my defendant could post bail but is refusing to give up his passport as a condition of his release.  And by much tighter timeline, I mean, my trial is set for Thursday and I need to provide items to defense attorney by end of the day on Tuesday.   Any chance you think we can pull a miracle on this one?  I have a copy of the Puerto Rican license—just not certified.   Thanks! Haleigh   Assistant District Attorney Haleigh A. subject: [Probable Spam] Brockton and Newton PDs: Fraudulent Jeep Purchases with False Puerto
body: Rican License - Arrests and Recoveries                                  Attention: New England Wide -

Subject: Brockton and Newton PD: Fraudulent Jeep Purchases with False Puerto Rican ID –
Arrests and Recoveries
-
Synopsis:
-
[On 1-15-19 an individual using a Counterfeit Puerto Rican License and Utility Bills showing
a Fall River Address was able to purchase and finance a new Jeep from McGovern Jeep in
Newton. Subject showed identification in the name of  , DOB
. Subject was approved for financing and drove the vehicle off the lot and apparently had it immediately registered.  
-
On 1-16-19, the same individual using the same identification and documents attempted to
purchase a new 2019 Jeep from Jeep 24 in Brockton. The suspect left the facility while the
financing was being approved and was to return when the financing was completed.  The
Financing Company noted the prior approval and determined that both applications were
fraudulent.  Brockton Police were notified and when the suspect was called back to pick up
the Jeep, he was arrested for identity fraud and attempted larceny.  He was subsequently
identified as  ,  , most recently of    Cruz had three active
warrants and claimed to have a   NH address. 
-
On 1-17-19, Methuen Police received a report of a GPS hit that the stolen “Newton” Jeep
was currently on East St. Officers located the Jeep and found a subject in the driver’s seat
who identified himself as  . He was subsequently arrested. During the
booking process he was positively identified as   ,  showing a 
 address.
During an inventory search, a “box” was found containing materials used to fabricate
identification cards.
-
these may not be the only two vehicles purchased
Secondary information indicates that  .  
Facial Recognition will be run on both individuals.
DHS/ICE is also investigating ]
 
Officer Chris Perez #387
Brockton Police Department
-Traffic Enforcement & Control Unit
-Active Threat Training Unit
(508) 328-1634
 
Officer Officer Griffin Waller
Methuen Police

He is no longer under supervision but we have a ton of his previous identities.  His case was prosecuted in the District of NH and we did supervision for them.  Interesting case though, he was charged with new offenses while on supervision and the state dismissed those charges and he was also the victim of an armed home invasion in Fitchburg.  See identifiers and docs below....  Also, the AUSA in NH thought he was   of the D.R., brother of previously deported  .  He also allegedly had a minor son (about age 7 in 2010)  , with a  . He   denied all that and came up with other names along the way for himself and his son!!

Please let us know if you need any additional assistance.
 
Respectfully,
Justin

body: Fusion (POL) <fusion@state.ma .us>  MacDonald, Casey T <CTMacDo nald@dea .usdoj.gov>  Good Afternoon,  Facial Recognition on photographs obtained from the Face book profiles that you provided  (htt;ps: I /www.facebook.com /profile.php?  id=100023033083081 &  returned a possible match  to the below named Massachusetts Dr iver's License or ID:  A query of S36317 620 in CJIS, however, r eturns a different photogra ph under the- - (DOB:  ID.  The Massachusetts Stat e Police Fraud Identification Unit does a much better job of explaining  the discrepancy, so I have copied Tpr. Malhotra (857-324-0411) on this e-mail and you may  wish to reach out to him for additional information if you have questions regarding the registry  side of things.  Facial Recognition on that first photograph of your suspect did not return any matches to any  additional MA licenses or IDs, so it does not appear that he has obtained any new credentials at  this point Similarly, Coplink FaceMatch has returned no close matches to any booking  photographs in the system. That said, there are a couple of address associated with the suspect  that might be useful to you:  - Listed on the Facial Recognition "match" that doesn't return  -Listed on the MA DL  (DOB:  . One of the photos on  Faceb  ook profile shows your suspect in  front of a vehicle bear ing MA:  3HD196, registered to  - also ap pears in a bunch of  the photos on t h e - profile  (possibly a girlfriend/spouse)?  NOTE: The result(s) of Facial Recognition provided by the Commonwealth Fusion Center are to be utilized as  an investigative lead only and are not to be considered a positive, confirmatory identification of any subject.  Any possible connection to or involvement of the subject(s ) to any active or ongoing investigation must be  substantiated through further investigation.  If you believe that a Massachusetts Driver's License or other Identification associated with an ongoing  criminal investigation may be fraudulently obtained, please contact the Massachusetts State Police Fraud  Identification Section directly- (857) 368-9500. subject: - - Identity Fraud
body: ~st  Good afternoon Lt.  Boyle:  I am prosecuting an identity fraud case in Salem District Court. My defendant was t he passenger in a  car that was pulled over. The defendant  initially told officers that he  (DOB : - ) residing at  Officers were able to discover that this Defendant was  using a Puerto Rican social security number  . At some point during this encounter,  the Defendant  provided officers w ith a Mass ID card  ); t he number came back with no  results in Massachusetts. This ID card was allegedly issued on 12/21/2017 and did not match a  license number for the Defendant(- ) The  Defendant claimed to have been born in Puerto  Rico and had never been issued a PR driver's license. Officers also reported that the Defendant had a  New Hampshire State ID as well as a criminal history in  NH . When officers ran the Defendant's Il l,  two FBI  numbers showed w ith the same demographic information. Officers were able to get in  contact with the t  w ho was born in  PR and now resides in the US. The  Defendant event ually confessed his true identity to be  · however, facial  recognition has not come back to confirm, so it is unclear as to w hether this is t ruly the Defendant's  name. Apparently, the RMV has initiated proceedings against the Defendant  for using a false social  security number, but t he Defendant defaulted on those matters.  I understand t hat you are able to get RMV documents to assist us in identity fraud cases. I would like  to request the Defendant's RMV applications as well as any investigative documents that the RMV  has collected relative to t he Defendant's identity and use of this name/social security number. If any  of t he information I have provided you with is unclear please let me know. I can give you more  information or forward you a copy of t he police report.  Thanks,  Daniel Oste  Assistant District Attorney  Essex District Attorney's Office  56 Federal Street  Salem, MA 01970  Phone:  978.744.5681 , x 4117  Fax:  978.744.9064  The preceding email message (including any attachments) contains information that may be confidential, may be protected by the attorney-client or  other applicable privileges, or may constit ute non-public information. body: Barton, Shannan (POL)  Boyle, Christopher (POL) <Christopher. Boy le@pol.st at e.ma.us>;  Fisher, Christine (POL)  <christine.fisher@ pol.st at e.ma .us>; Gawron, Stephen (POL) <stephen.gawron@pol.state.ma. us>;  O' Leary, Sarah  (POL) <Sarah.OLearv@po l.state.ma. us>; Oley, Carl (POL) <carl.oley @pol.state.ma.us>;  O'Hara, Brian (POL) <Brian.OHara@pol.st at e.ma .us>; Range, Scott (POL)  <scott .range@pol.state.ma.us>; Rigolio, Jackie (POL) <jackie.rigolio@pol.state.ma.us>; Smith,  Eleanor (POL) <Eieanor.Sm it h@pol.st at e.ma.us>  Good Afternoon,  We received t he below request from t he Bost on Regional Int elligence Center. Attached are t he two  fake Rhode Island drivers licenses they provided for us to run facial  recognition on. I ran  both images  and got potential matches to MA DLs, with different names and DOBs than attached to the RI DLs.   I ran both RI DL numbers in CJIS, but one is listed as not on file and the other is associated to a different name and DOB. I then ran the names and DOBs on the licenses in CJIS and found individuals that match the information on the licenses (except for the DL number and Image).   It does not appear to be the typical fraud ID case, but they are using names, addresses, and DOBs of real Rhode Island residents. I figured I would pass the information along with the supporting documentation for further review.   Respectfully,   Shannan   Shannan F. Barton   Intelligence Analyst Commonwealth Fusion Center 470 Worcester Road Framingham, MA 01702 508-820-2233 shannan.barton@state.ma.us

subject: [Probable Spam] Brockton and Newton PDs: Fraudulent Jeep Purchases with False Puerto
body: Rican License - Arrests and Recoveries                                  Attention: New England Wide -

Subject: Brockton and Newton PD: Fraudulent Jeep Purchases with False Puerto Rican ID –
Arrests and Recoveries
-
Synopsis:
-
[On 1-15-19 an individual using a Counterfeit Puerto Rican License and Utility Bills showing
a Fall River Address was able to purchase and finance a new Jeep from McGovern Jeep in
Newton. Subject showed identification in the name apparently had it immediately registered.  
-
On 1-16-19, the same individual using the same identification and documents attempted to
purchase a new 2019 Jeep from Jeep 24 in Brockton. The suspect left the facility while the
financing was being approved and was to return when the financing was completed.  The
Financing Company noted the prior approval and determined that both applications were
fraudulent.  Brockton Police were notified and when the suspect was called back to pick up
the Jeep, he was arrested for identity fraud and attempted larceny.  He was subsequently
identified as  , most recently of Lawrence.    had three active
warrants and claimed to have a Manchester NH address. 
-
On 1-17-19, Methuen Police received a report of a GPS hit that the stolen “Newton” Jeep
was currently on East St. Officers located the Jeep and found a subject in the driver’s seat
who identified himself as  . He was subsequently arrested. During the
booking process he was positively identified as    showing a 680 Hicks
St.Fall River address.
During an inventory search, a “box” was found containing materials used to fabricate
identification cards.
-
these may not be the only two vehicles purchased
Secondary information indicates that  .  
Facial Recognition will be run on both individuals.
DHS/ICE is also investigating ]
 
Officer Chris Perez #387
Brockton Police Department

> Good afternoon. Both his ME license and his MA license were run in facial recognition and in facematch in
Coplink. There were no additional MA licenses or MA identities found. His name was entered into Clear, and in
TLO. There is a   address that comes up in his information and his wife’s (  
has a facebook address, but there is no information on it and a couple relatives were tried but had no social media
profiles. His name was searched in AFIS, Inmate Web, Midnet, and a (III) was ran to see if he was in any other
states. He was negative in AFIS, Inmate Web, and Midnet. None of the reports are saying he is deceased. There was
an obituary in   for an   but the image did not match. His social was also ran in clear to see if there
were additional names with no luck. His wife has an email address with an ending for Tampa Bay RR. I am not sure
if that has any meaning. If you would like, we can try to send the photo to a few states to do facial recognition if you
would like. Attached is the clear report for him and his wife, the TLO report, and the warrant for him. Please let me
know if there is anything additional that I can do. Thanks.
>
